title: 107_hr2252
content: The Act titled "Conduit Contribution Prevention Act of 2001" increases penalties for violations of conduit contribution ban. The Act "Conduit Contribution Prevention Act of 2001" increases civil money penalties for knowing and willful violations of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971. Penalties are now not less than 300 percent of the amount involved in the violation and not more than the greater of $50,000 or 1000 percent of the amount involved. The Act "Conduit Contribution Prevention Act of 2001" increases civil money penalties for violations of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to not less than 300 percent of the amount involved and not more than $50,000 or 1000 percent of the amount involved. Additionally, there is an increase in criminal penalties under Section 309(d)(1) of the Act. The Act "Conduit Contribution Prevention Act of 2001" increases civil money penalties for violations of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to not less than 300 percent of the amount involved and not more than $50,000 or 1000 percent of the amount involved. Additionally, any person who knowingly and willfully commits a violation involving an amount aggregating $1,000 or more during a calendar year shall be fined, or imprisoned for not more than 2 years, or both. The Act "Conduit Contribution Prevention Act of 2001" increases penalties for violations of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971. Any person who knowingly commits a violation involving $1,000 or more in a calendar year shall be fined, imprisoned for up to 2 years, or both. The fine will be at least 300 percent of the amount involved, not exceeding $50,000 or 1000 percent of the violation amount. The United States Sentencing Commission will establish guidelines for penalties for these violations. The amendments to the Federal Election Campaign Act include mandatory referral to the Attorney General for violations of section 320 and an extension of the statute of limitations to 5 years for such violations. These changes apply to violations occurring after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 3 extends the ban on foreign contributions to all campaign-related disbursements. The Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 is amended to prohibit disbursements by foreign nationals, including to political committees and for independent expenditures.
